oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Polk motel: office
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eatherly, Brad, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of an office and carport of a historic motel viewed from the northeast. The office has a central door with two large windows flanking each side. The east elevation has one large sixteen-pane window facing Highway 31. A small living quarters sits behind the office on the left. The brick structures feature hipped roofs. The motel rooms can be seen on the right.

The Polk Motel was built in 1947. The motel is named after President James K. Polk and the Polk family, early prominent citizens of Columbia, Maury County, TN. The motel was utilized by travelers before Interstate 65 was constructed. It is a good example of a mid-twentieth century roadside motel.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Motels
